description_txt: stated on August 27, 2014 in press conference:
quote_txt: Georgia can substantially increase its funding for education by going after $2.5 billion in uncollected taxes.

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2014 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says Rick Scott cut education by over a billion dollars, meaning thousands of teachers "lost their jobs" and "class sizes went up."

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2014 in a Facebook meme:
quote_txt: Says Sen. Mark Begich is ineffective because he has only "passed one bill, the naming of a building."

description_txt: stated on August 27, 2014 in TV ad:
quote_txt: A Scott Rothstein victim says that he was "swindled" by Charlie Crist.

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2014 in a video.:
quote_txt: The U.S. Constitution is "the oldest written constitution still in use today" among nations.

description_txt: stated on September 1, 2014 in interview on The Monica Perez Show, WSB:
quote_txt: "The state budget has increased almost $800 million a year in each of the last two years."

description_txt: stated on September 21, 2014 in a panel on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: Americans now "support strikes (against ISIS) but the support for ground troops is not there. The support is very thin."

description_txt: stated on September 21, 2014 in a panel on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: "Last week's three most-viewed television programs were Sunday Night Football, Thursday Night Football and Monday Night Football."

description_txt: stated on September 8, 2014 in oped commentary:
quote_txt: "To deprive" underprivileged children "of a meat-based protein during school lunch is most likely depriving them of their only source of protein for the day."

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2014 in a TV commercial:
quote_txt: "When I left office, there was a $7-million surplus in Providence," but in 2008, the city had a $110-million deficit.

description_txt: stated on September 15, 2014 in a radio ad:
quote_txt: In 2012, "Wall Street" gave Scott Brown "more campaign contributions than any other candidate -- $5.3 million."

description_txt: stated on September 18, 2014 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Says "President Obama hijacked the farm bill (and) turned it into a food stamp bill."

description_txt: stated on September 15, 2014 in a post on InfoWars.com:
quote_txt: "The U.S. State Department has ordered 160,000 Hazmat suits for Ebola, prompting concerns that the federal government is anticipating the rapid spread" of the virus.

description_txt: stated on August 29, 2014 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Our men and women of the Guard have been forced to contact food banks to feed themselves."

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2014 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Says Tom Steyer is a "California billionaire who stands to profit by blocking Keystone" and "is spending big to help" Bruce Braley.

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2014 in an interview:
quote_txt: Says Scott Walker's jobs agency gives financial incentives that lead "Wisconsin companies to look at shipping jobs elsewhere. ... A company got $4.6 million in taxpayer money and actually reduced its jobs by 300 people."

description_txt: stated on September 13, 2014 in a fundraiser invitation:
quote_txt: Michelle Nunn "spent most of her childhood" in Perry, Ga.

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2014 in a segment on MSNBC's "Morning Joe":
quote_txt: "Super Bowl Sunday has the highest rate of domestic violence."

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2014 in a post on the Media Matters blog:
quote_txt: Says Fox News gave Republican senators twice the air time as Democrats during a hearing about the Islamic State.

description_txt: stated on September 15, 2014 in Internet posts:
quote_txt: "Three of five detainees swapped (for Bowe Bergdahl) are now ISIS leaders."

description_txt: stated on September 11, 2014 in a question to White House Press Secretary Josh Earnest:
quote_txt: The Obama administration is using as its "legal justification for these airstrikes (on the Islamic State), an authorization for military force that the president himself has called for repeal of."

description_txt: stated on September 12, 2014 in a fundraising email :
quote_txt: Recently Rick Scott "closed 30 women’s health care centers across the state."

description_txt: stated on September 11, 2014 in a Facebook graphic:
quote_txt: "There is no state in the U.S. where a 40-hour minimum wage work week is enough to afford a two-bedroom apartment."

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2014 in an interview on ESPN's "Mike and Mike":
quote_txt: "Much more than 50 percent of parents out there are spankers."

description_txt: stated on September 12, 2014 in a phone conference:
quote_txt: "It is true that we know that ISIS is present in Ciudad Juarez (Mexico)"

description_txt: stated on September 3, 2014 in a campaign web page:
quote_txt: "57% of the jobs created" in Austin "from 2009 to 2013 do not pay families a living wage."

description_txt: stated on September 14, 2014 in a campaign news release:
quote_txt: Since I took office, "Wisconsin ranks 11th in the nation in total business establishment growth compared to 47th in the years Mary Burke was Commerce secretary."

description_txt: stated on September 15, 2014 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: "New Hampshire has lost more jobs to China than any other state."

description_txt: stated on September 11, 2014 in a message to viewers:
quote_txt: "More than three women per day lose their lives at the hands of their partners."

description_txt: stated on September 8, 2014 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: Of the 98 top oxycodone-dispensing doctors who used to live in Florida, "today, there are none."
